div.p: Affinity of net total carbon uptake, shown as K 0.5 in wild-type and high selection (numbered) lines acclimated to 1050 ppm CO 2 (filled bars, H) and air (white bars, A). Net total carbon uptake was calculated as bicarbonate uptake + net CO 2 uptake). Each bar represents averages Â± standard error of the mean from independent duplicate or triplicate measurements. Accompanying table shows effect of changes in carbon uptake rates and population size on carbon sink calculations. From Collins et al. (2006).
